alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Doddridge; Gilmer; Harrison; Lewis; Ritchie (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 3:11PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Calhoun, southern Ritchie, Doddridge, northern Gilmer, northern Lewis and southwestern Harrison Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 311 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of Grantsville, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Weston, Harrisville, Grantsville, Salem, West Union, Jackson Mill, Pullman, Auburn, Smithville, Newberne, Alum Bridge, Big Springs, Berea, Tanner, Burnt House, Camden, Greenwood, Blandville, Avon, and Grove. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 101 and 103. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 43 and 65. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for northern, north central and northwestern West Virginia.
